intro: Melandrium dicline, commonly known as the common catchfly, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Caryophyllaceae. It is characterized by its erect, branching stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, pinkish or reddish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Melandrium dicline is native to Europe, western Asia, and North Africa, and it often grows in disturbed soils and open habitats. It is an annual or biennial plant, depending on the climate, and is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
